name: Hotel Banke

reviews.text: Arrived in pouring rain and were welcomed in with smiles and umbrellas - we didn't eat here but used the hotel as a base. We found the staff very helpful if things were not right they sorted with smiles - lovely ambiance - stunning entrance hall - a fine quirky hotel just up from rue d'Opera - we had two rooms as our kids are teenagers - all worked very well. Thank you Hotel Banke. Good Wifi. Only English channel was world news - but not a problem as lots more to do outside in Paris!
reviews.title: A friendly hotel in Paris

reviews.text: I visited this hotel whilst in Paris for work so i didnt pick this myself. Whilst it looks very grand inside, the room I was in was so hot. I had the worst night sleep. Light was seeping through the door and I was boiling all night. In the end i opened the window and then was kept awake with noise from outside. Quite a disappointing stay. The bathroom overlooked some offices and they could pretty much see in.
reviews.title: Not a comfortable stay

reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning was very good though and as well as continental options you could order a hot cooked brekki too.
reviews.title: Quality sorely lacking

reviews.text: No air conditioning for whole stay. Requested daily to have situation rectified and promises went unanswered until I demanded a price adjustment. Ten percent did not do justice to the extreme inconvenience during a 90 degree week. Manager stated that problem was just w/some of the rooms. Why wasn't I moved to another room then? Room was not ready upon arrival, even though it was after 3pm. Had to request bath/shower be cleaned. Spacious room for euro standards, but broken furniture and darkness, plus no a/c equaling little sleep, almost ruined our vacation. Vacuuming at 6 am unnecessary. Nearby construction loud. Initial greeters lovely and helpful. Room service couldn't get our order of 2 items correct, even after 3 phone calls. Food deliverer unfriendly and unapologetic. Front desk sometimes friendly, often unhelpful. Paris is awesome, just not at the Banke Hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Comfortable boutique, could be improved
reviews.text: Rooms were very small, even by European standards. Problem with room cooling. Had to be moved to different room on second day. Breakfast is very good. Did not try the main hotel restaurant.

Stayed for one night on a business trip, but would not classify as such: I would have been very happy staying here on holiday with my family. Very clean and comfortable, very helpful and pleasant staff, good breakfast. I would recommend the location if on holiday, within walking distance of many attractions. I cannot comment on price as I was fortunate not to be paying.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, excellent location, good service,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent four nights at Hotel Banke, having booked through Small Luxury Hotels. The service we received from everybody at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Our junior suite was very comfortable - the best air conditioning we found during our four weeks in Europe - and the hotel lobby/restaurant/bar area are striking. The breakfast was delicious. Ours was included in our rate as SLH members, but I do understand other reviewers who felt it was a bit pricey and chose to find breakfast elsewhere. The location of this hotel is perfect - more of a "neighborhood" feel (near the Opera) but very close to metro stations that are only a couple of stops from the Louvre - or you could walk. We would highly recommend the Hotel Banke.
reviews.title: Great service, great location, striking decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Banke offers a quality boutique hotel experience at a reasonable price. Think 4 star hotel with a 3 star price. It is conveniently located in the Opera section of Paris, which from my experience and research provides the best value for accommodations. The hotel is walking distance to the Louvre and the Champs Elysees and is less than a 15 minute Metro ride or taxi ride from all other tourist sites and popular dining/nightlife.
reviews.title: Splendid experience at Hotel Banke

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Paris for four days, primarily to go sightseeing during the day and to enjoy Parisian restaurants and nightlife in the evening. The staff at Hotel Banke was warm and very helpful. While they technically do not have a concierge, the front desk staff did manage to purchase museum tickets and tour tickets in advance for us and also helped make restaurant recommendations and reservations. The rooms at Banke are small, but I believe that is common in Europe, especially Paris. The hotel also has a nice restaurant and bar.
reviews.title: Short break

reviews.text: Special thanks to Fanny, Sara and Victoria for all their help.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel

reviews.text: Great property with good location for leisure or business trip in Paris and next to the tube station. Walking distance from the main shopping malls as well as Le Louvre & Tuileries.
reviews.title: Best stay in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed already on several occasions and always very satisfied with the services and facilities.
reviews.title: Anniversary trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: honeymoon in Paris

reviews.text: The restaurant and bar offer very nice suggestions (nice cocktails at Lola Bar) and good room service.
reviews.title: ideal location

reviews.text: Bedrooms are very confortable, very good housekeeping service and have wooden floor.
reviews.title: A hotel with real character!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed for one night in a executive room. We were being offered to upgrade, and was shown a deluxe room and a suite. Those rooms looked nice as well, but really - if you have a nice bed, a sofa, bathroom and toilet, you don't need much more. Especially not for one night. Also, comparing the "better" rooms by look, I don't think they added much more value.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.text: Everyone at the hotel was kindly. Cleanliness was good.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings - dont expect too much

reviews.text: There was soap, shampoo and conditioner etc. at the room - that's good. I don't mind bringing my own, but when you travel light, it's nice to have these things available.
reviews.title: OVERRATED HOTEL

reviews.text: Minibar...It's a joke. How can anyone seriously charge €8,50,- for a coca cola? Some hotels are now having a free minibar (like Angleterre in Berlin). I mean, I could go to a nice bar and have a coca-cola served for less, and even have money to spare for tips.
reviews.title: Banke hotel is like a bank, you loose your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a single room and checked in at 1pm but was surprised that there was no chair to sit on in the room, the reception desk were curt and said this was normal and that single rooms do not have chairs however they could they send up a chair to the room …….. I also asked to speak to the manager who never called me. In the evening when I returned from meetings I noticed the air con did not work the desk staff had changed shift this time they could not be more helpful I changed rooms in 15 mins air con worked perfectly would I return? …………….. probably not (PS the elusive chair never did appear nor did the manager call )
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel very close to shopping

description: Boutique hotel in the centre of Paris, ideal for your stay whether you are on a business trip or vacationing with your partner, with friends or with your family.This superior four-star hotel is located in the Opera district, in the very heart of Paris and a stone's throw from Boulevard Haussmann and the Galeries Lafayette. Hotel Banke occupies a building from the beginning of the 20th century designed by architects Paul Friesse and Cassien Bernard, and the stately building sits at the junction of Rue La Fayette and Rue Pillet Will.Services:94 guest rooms in Paris: 15 single rooms, 40 superior rooms, 13 executive rooms, 9 deluxe rooms and 17 suitesJosefin RestaurantLolaBarBreakfast buffet24-hour room service and mini-barBusiness centreWi-Fi in all areasFunction rooms and related spaces: Eiffel room, La Fayette room, Alcove 1 room, Alcove 2 room, Banke RestaurantBanke Restaurant for events and conventions
